events.name: Meetup #2: Cloud Transformation & Teaching and Learning in the Cloud
events.description: Date :  29th June 2017 (Thurs) Time :[masked] Venue : Singapore Polytechnic, LT12C . Please see map attached  Driving: Enter from Gate 8, Commonwealth Avenue West. MRT: Dover MRT Registration form: https://goo.gl/forms/HAXuonTMEVcutZi73   Theme : ASU Cloud Transformation & Teaching and Learning in the Cloud Agenda 18:30Hrs – 19:00Hrs : Networking : Refreshments and Drinks 19:00Hrs : Opening and Introduction  19:00Hrs – 19:30pm  :  Case Study: Arizona State University’s Cloud Transformation Journey by Chris Richardson (ASU) [via Skype] Arizona State University (ASU) has clinched the title of US’s most innovative school for two years in a row, according to U.S. News & World Report college rankings. Chris Richardson, Assistant Vice President of IT Development at ASU, will speak about how ASU has embraced cloud services to enhance delivery of digital services to its constituents. Latest article on ASU: https://www.forbes.com/delltechnologies/changeagents/#157fea772c32 19:30Hrs – 19:50Hrs :  Case Study : AWS for Teaching and Learning by Lee Chye Seng (Singapore University of Social Sciences) Lee Chye Seng, Director of Learning Systems and Applications Department at SUSS will discuss how SUSS leverages AWS's services to deliver learning to their students. 19:50Hrs – 20:10Hrs  Case Study : Micro-Learning for the Agile Organization by Roslina Chai (Gnowbe) Find out more about micro-learning and how it helps institutions e.g. Ngee Ann Polytechnic in its learning to enhance organization’s performance.   20:10Hrs – 20:30Hrs : Engage.Enpower.Learn by Philip Murry (Blackboard)Join the discussion with Philip Murry, Regional Vice President, ASIA at Blackboard who will talk about engaging and empowering students in a collaborative learning platform on the cloud. 20:30Hrs – 20:45Hrs :  Questions and Answers

events.name: WWCodeSg Data Visualization 101 in Tableau/R
events.description: Delivered to you by our data lead and visualization expert Hannah Yan Han; This talk and hands-on session cover the importance of data visualization as a communication medium, various visual encodings and chart types for constructing a coherent story and include step-by-step demo and hands-on for creating visualization in open source tools, Tableau Public and RStudio. Agenda:6:30 PM: Registration & Food (Pizza)7:00 PM: Why Data Visualization7:15 PM: Data Visualization Talk7:40 PM: Q&A, short break before hands-on7:50 PM: Tableau demo and R coding session8:30 PM: Wrap Up Please be aware that WIFI is not available during this event. Please install Tableau Public (https://public.tableau.com/), R(mac or windows) and RStudio desktop (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download2/) before you arrive. Try your hands on both the Tableau and RStudio at home and install these R packages first  (ggplot2, rmarkdown). The code for hands-on session can be downloaded here (http://bit.ly/wwcode_r) Psst... this event is intended for ladies only. Host:Singapore Power
events.location: SP Digital, 240, Tanjong Pagar Road, #08-00 Keppel Tower 2, (S) 088540, Singapore

events.name: DevSecOps June meetup: Security in the Delivery Pipeline and HashiCorp Vault
events.description:
** DevSecOps Singapore is free for anyone to attend ** • Networking: 15 Mins • Introduction to HashiCorp Vault by Fabian Lim : 45mins • Security in the Delivery Pipeline by James Wickett : 45 mins Abstract: Security in the Delivery Pipeline by James Wickett Security testing is often relegated to the end of software delivery to the detriment of quality and safety. Often security gets aligned with compliance timelines or other long-cycle process inside an organization. This session is complete reversal of the status quo and we will cover modern approaches to security in your CI/CD pipelines. You will gain experience with some of the testing tools and processes needed to make this happen. We will also cover some advice for dealing with compliance and security engineers as you make a transition to TDD-style approach to security. Introduction to HashiCorp Vault  The session will focus on the introduction to Vault that secures, stores, and tightly controls access to tokens, passwords, certificates, API keys, and other secrets in modern computing. Vault handles leasing, key revocation, key rolling, and auditing. Through a unified API, users can access an encrypted Key/Value store and network encryption-as-a-service, or generate AWS IAM/STS credentials, SQL/NoSQL databases, X.509 certificates, SSH credentials, and more.  



Speakers Bio:  James spends a lot of time at the intersection of the DevOps and Security communities. He works as Head of Research at Signal Sciences and is a supporter of the Rugged Software and Rugged DevOps movements. Seeing the gap in software testing, James founded an open source project, Gauntlt, to serve as a Rugged Testing Framework. He is the author of DevOps Fundamentals, Infrastructure Automation, both DevOps core courses available on Lynda.com and LinkedIn Learning. Fabian born and brewed in Singapore, learned his software engineering skills while working in the USA contributing DevSecOps engineer. What excites him most is cybersecurity, red teaming, fitness and of course quality alcohol. A practitioner of various martial arts and a Krav Maga instructor.

events.name: DevOps on Azure using Kubernetes
events.description:
Please register at security counter at level 1 and then proceed to level 21.  On level 21 look for room Room 21MPR-01. 



I am excited to announce two talks at this User Group. 1. CoreOS and Kubernetes - Ambrose Chua 2. DevOps on Azure using Kubernetes - Vincent De Smet 

Ambrose Chua will be doing a short talk on CoreOS and Kubernetes. 

 CoreOS was recently renamed Container Linux. 

Container Linux by CoreOS (formerly CoreOS Linux) is an open-source lightweight operating system based on the Linux kernel and designed for providing infrastructure to clustered deployments, while focusing on automation, ease of application deployment, security, reliability and scalability.  

Then Vincent De Smet from honestbee will deliver a talk on DevOps on Azure using Kubernetes. 

 Vincent's talk will be based on the Gist link below. Link : https://gist.github.com/so0k/cc51cfccebd0e1d669ce7900c3c6a8f8
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium , One Marina Boulevard, Level 21, Singapore
